moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Just look at him he's guilty? Seriously?
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: What if I look at him and I see he's not guilty? Where do you get off judging people like that?
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: In fact, I happen to know the defendant. So if we're going on moral character here, I'm the only person in this room who should have an opinion on the matter.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: I can judge whomever I please! Hell, you know him so well. Why don't you tell me about him? Does he have a job or is he another unemployed deadbeat?
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Until the indictment, he was working 9 to 5 at Exytech.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Well I'll bet he's never been to church! Godless as his acts, he'd probably catch fire if he walked past the threshold.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: He goes every Sunday!
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: How do you not know that? Wouldn't you have seen him there at some point?
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Well. Um.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: I actually haven't been getting down there lately.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: I'm, uh, worshipping him from home, you see.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: I really should get down there more.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: And you feel it right to judge a man for not going to church when you don't even go yourself?
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: mason

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Hmmph...
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Well if the man is as god fearing as you say...
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Perhaps I **********************************may ********************have judged him a little too quickly.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Tell you what. ********************************************************************If you all think he's not guilty, I won't stand in your way.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: It takes a big man to admit he's wrong. Good on ya, pops.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: eddie

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Hopefully we can move forward based on the facts, rather than the fancy.
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: clive

moralFabricOfAmerica.text: Lets move on, shall we? We haven't got all day here!
moralFabricOfAmerica.speaker: geoff

murderIsUncool.text: I don't think it was very "cool" for the victim.
murderIsUncool.speaker: lynne

murderIsUncool.text: Oh, I didn't mean it like that!
murderIsUncool.speaker: kylie

murderIsUncool.text: Not like it was cool that a lady got murdered, just that a murder trial is more interesting for the jurors.
murderIsUncool.speaker: kylie

murderIsUncool.text: I'm sure you didn't. But it still sounded disrespectful.
murderIsUncool.speaker: lynne

murderIsUncool.text: C'mon, it's just some poor wording. It's no big deal.
murderIsUncool.speaker: mason

murderIsUncool.text: This isn't entertainment. A woman is dead and we hold this man's fate in our hands. We must take it seriously.
murderIsUncool.speaker: lynne

juryNullification.text: Oh god, please don't tell him.
juryNullification.speaker: lynne

juryNullification.text: When you're on a jury, you don't actually have to vote guilty just because he's guilty. You can vote not guilty if you don't think the defendant should be punished. Or if you think he had a good reason for doing what he did.
juryNullification.speaker: kylie

juryNullification.text: How long has that been around?
juryNullification.speaker: eddie

juryNullification.text: It's always been around. The jurors are the ones who decide whether someone is guilty. You're told to decide based on the facts of the case. But there's nothing stopping you from making your decision on another basis.
juryNullification.speaker: kylie

juryNullification.text: Well alright. I might just try that out.
juryNullification.speaker: eddie

juryNullification.text: I'm not up for lettin' a man get away with murder. But him sockin' some stuffy law man in the face?
juryNullification.speaker: eddie

juryNullification.text: You really shouldn't have told him.
juryNullification.speaker: lynne

justDoingHisJob.text: That is a horrible thing to say! He is a public servant and he does not deserve to be attacked while he is doing his job!
justDoingHisJob.speaker: lynne

justDoingHisJob.text: He was kind of an tool in that court room though.
justDoingHisJob.speaker: henry

tooWeakToPunch.text: That's the only part of this case I don't get. I'll eat my damn shoe if that undernourished little punk could cause that much damage.
tooWeakToPunch.speaker: geoff

tooWeakToPunch.text: Hey, you may be on to something, pops! I've seen my fair share of boxing matches and I'll be damned if that kid would weigh in any higher than a bantamweight.
tooWeakToPunch.speaker: eddie

tooWeakToPunch.text: He looked very undernourished in general.
tooWeakToPunch.speaker: clive

tooWeakToPunch.text: And now you got me thinkin', is there any universe where this kid could knock out a trained police officer with those twiggy little arms of his?
tooWeakToPunch.speaker: eddie

tooWeakToPunch.text: Certainly not the one we're in, that's for damn sure.
tooWeakToPunch.speaker: geoff

tooWeakToPunch.text: Shit, you're right. Thinking back on it, whoever threw that punch must have been one big badass. And I hate to say it, but James definitely does not fit that bill.
tooWeakToPunch.speaker: mason

heWouldNotWantMoney.text: From what I know of him, he's really not the money-grubbing sort.
heWouldNotWantMoney.speaker: mason

heWouldNotWantMoney.text: He was saving up to buy a house, but he said it was so he would have somewhere to start a family when he proposed to Megan.
heWouldNotWantMoney.speaker: mason

heWouldNotWantMoney.text: That's what I'm sayin'. I fashion myself a good judge of character. If that man were fixin' to kill his lover, it wouldn't be so he could get his hands on some extra pocket change.
heWouldNotWantMoney.speaker: eddie

officerTranscript.text: No, hold on, I remember thinking that too.
officerTranscript.speaker: henry

officerTranscript.text: It was when that other officer took the stand. The one who arrived later on the scene.
officerTranscript.speaker: henry

officerTranscript.text: Let me pull up the transcript here.
officerTranscript.speaker: henry

officerTranscript.text:
CROSS EXAMINATION OF OFFICER M. GRADY - PAGE 2

Q	Why not?

A	It wasn't considered a high priority call at the time. Domestic disturbances usually aren't high priority.

Q	So when did you show up at the crime scene?

A	I got there at 8:09 PM.

Q	And what was happening when you arrived?

A	Officer Young had just been punched by the defendant. He had blood all down his face. I assisted officer Young by putting the defendant into the back of the squad car.

Q	Did you Mirandize the defendant?

A	No, he had already been Mirandized, cuffed, and everything. I just put him into the car.

Q	Were there any other people there aside from you, officer Young, and the defendant?

A	There were the forensics guys, but they were all still inside the house bagging up the evidence.
officerTranscript.speaker: system

officerTranscript.text: So he had handcuffs already on when officer Grady showed up.
officerTranscript.speaker: henry

officerTranscript.text: How do you suppose the defense missed that?
officerTranscript.speaker: logan

officerTranscript.text: Then how could he have broken the officer's nose with his hands cuffed behind his back?
officerTranscript.speaker: lynne

pawnShopOwnerMistaken.text: That's actually something I wanted to bring up. I think the pawn shop owner's report to the police was a bit vague and innaccurate.
pawnShopOwnerMistaken.speaker: alice

pawnShopOwnerMistaken.text: When the police first talked with him, he described a short, brown-haired man with brown eyes. Now, the defendant is definitely short.
pawnShopOwnerMistaken.speaker: alice

pawnShopOwnerMistaken.text: But his hair is more of a dirty blonde. I certainly wouldn't call it brown.
pawnShopOwnerMistaken.speaker: alice

pawnShopOwnerMistaken.text: And all of these qualities are pretty vague, don't you think?
pawnShopOwnerMistaken.speaker: logan

pawnShopOwnerMistaken.text: There are a lot of brown-haired brown-eyed men walking around in this country.
pawnShopOwnerMistaken.speaker: logan

pawnShopOwnerMistaken.text: Although, he did still indentify him in court. So what do I know?
pawnShopOwnerMistaken.speaker: alice

pawnShopOwnerMistaken.text: Still, I'd say there's room for doubt as to whether he really recognized the defendant or just thought he did.
pawnShopOwnerMistaken.speaker: logan

pawnShopOwnerMistaken.text: You know what? That's a good point.
pawnShopOwnerMistaken.speaker: clive

pawnShopOwnerMistaken.text: I supposed there's room for reasonable doubt.
pawnShopOwnerMistaken.speaker: lynne

tooMuchBlood.text: Yeah, kinda. Do you think so?
tooMuchBlood.speaker: kylie

tooMuchBlood.text: In fact, thinking about it now,
tooMuchBlood.speaker: logan

tooMuchBlood.text: it might have been caused by a medical condition called "Hyper-Hemo-Epistaxis".
tooMuchBlood.speaker: logan

tooMuchBlood.text: In the photos, do you remember if the area around his nose had a purple-ish color to it?
tooMuchBlood.speaker: logan

tooMuchBlood.text: In the few spots where there wasn't blood, I think so!
tooMuchBlood.speaker: kylie

tooMuchBlood.text: Yeah, I think it was a little purple there.
tooMuchBlood.speaker: clive

tooMuchBlood.text: Perhaps that's what caused all the bleeding. Maybe cop just had a flare-up of his Hyper-Hemo-Epistaxis and decided to blame it on the defendant!
tooMuchBlood.speaker: logan

tooMuchBlood.text: Why would he do that, though?
tooMuchBlood.speaker: clive

tooMuchBlood.text: Maybe he's embarrassed about his condition and came up with a way to cover it up.
tooMuchBlood.speaker: kylie
